group.name: capture_point
group.description: Tuning for capture points (fuel, ammo, manpower, victory)

group.name: capture_order_animation
group.description: Tuning values that affect the animation of the capture point icon on the minimap. This animation is triggered when a squad is ordered to capure the capture point. The icon will flash a few times between low and high opacity.

float.name: flash_pulse_duration
float.description: Time in seconds to go from high to low opacity, then back to high opacity.

int.name: flash_pulse_repetition_count
int.description: The number of pulses in the flashing animation.

group.name: capturing_animation
group.description: Tuning values that affect the animation of the capture point icon on the minimap. This animation happens when the local player captures a point (neutral to own team) and when contesting (enemy to neutral). An icon with a white ring and a green chevron will rotate at a constant speed.

float.name: time_for_full_rotation
float.description: The time in seconds it takes for the capture ring to make a full rotation.

colour.name: facing_cone_start_colour
colour.description: Start colour in a radial gradiant used for the team weapons & emplacements while actively setting the facing. This colour is used at the minimum range.

colour.name: facing_cone_end_colour
colour.description: End colour in a radial gradiant used for the team weapons & emplacements while actively setting the facing. This colour is used at the maximum range.

float.name: facing_cone_max_angle
float.description: If the total angle from left to right of the facing cone is larger than this value, the facing cone will not be displayed. Angle is in degrees.

group.name: movement_line
group.description: Movement lines will be visible when a squad is ordered to move, attack capture, ....

group.name: fade_out_anim
group.description: The line will remain visible for some time, then fade out. Queueing more commands will show the lines, if they were hidden, then retart the fade out anim.

group.name: save_game
group.description: Timing info for the different popups in save game page.

float.name: delete_in_progress_min_time
float.description: A popup is displayed while a save is deleted. If the operation is really fast, then the popup is barely seen if at all. Use this to make sure the popup is visible for at least the specified time. In seconds.

float.name: delete_confirm_time
float.description: After a file has been deleted, a popup is displayed to confirm that the file was deleted. In seconds.

float.name: load_in_progress_time
float.description: A popup is displayed before a save is loaded, this happends before the loading screen. Use this to control how long the popup should be visible. In seconds.

float.name: save_in_progress_min_time
float.description: A popup is displayed while a save is saved. If the operation is really fast, then the popup is barely seen if at all. Use this to make sure the popup is visible for at least the specified time. In seconds.

float.name: save_confirm_time
float.description: After a file has been saved, a popup is displayed to confirm that the file was saved. In seconds.

int.name: custom_save_name_max_length
int.description: Max length of a manual save

file.name: hud_save_load_page
file.description: Path to a XAML page to display the load prompt, save/load in progress and save complete dialogs when the player quick saves or quick loads.

group.name: ui_strings
group.description: Used for anvil specific localized strings by name in anvil code. The name in the ui_strings group corresponds to the name to be used in code. Add additional items to the template to add more strings.

bool.name: scale_fx_on_cmap
bool.description: The campaign map (cmap) reuses visual assets, but scales them down. FX, by default, don't scale relative to the assets that spawn them, which leads to FX that are too large on the cmap. This makes FX scale relative to the objects in the cmap.

bool.name: scale_splats_on_cmap
bool.description: The campaign map (cmap) reuses visual assets, but scales them down. Splats, by default, don't scale relative to the assets that spawn them, which leads to splats that are too large on the cmap. This makes splats scale relative to the objects in the cmap.
